item.title: Creating My Digital Garden
item.description: 7/29/23 I’ve always wanted to have a personal website. Never really knew what its purpose would be but I’ve always wanted to have one.

item.title: Digital Cities
item.description: Growing up, I had an idea for a website. Initially there would be one starting point (node), or maybe a couple based on region/language.

item.title: Digital Garden
item.description: alt.

item.title: Hugo
item.description: A static site generator.

item.title: Humble Beginnings
item.description: 08/03/21 It took me a few days, but I finally got things together. I was stumped for a little while, trying to figure out why the CSS for my page wasn’t rendering.

item.title: Japanese Hard Shake
item.description: Invented by Kazuo Uyeda. Common misconception is that Uyeda says, “only he can do the hard shake right.” What he actually means is that no two hard shakes will be the same, each person has different rhythms, different heights, arm lengths, etc.

item.title: Knowledge Management
item.description: A method of ensuring required knowledge is accessible by others when needed.

item.title: Motivation is Shit
item.description: This is an idea that has resonated with me since (at least) high school. Motivation is shit. Often times, I bring this up and lot of people will do their best to defend motivation.

item.title: Obsidian
item.description: A note taking app that easily allows the ability to create backlinks to different notes. https://obsidian.md/community Useful link: Advanced formatting in markdown for Obsidian - https://help.

item.title: PARA
item.description: PARA stands for: Project Area Resource Archive The different categories can be determined based on [[Resource/wiki/productivity/Actionability|Actionability]]. Projects are the most actionable and have a deadline.

item.title: Personal Information Management
item.description: The way you obtain and store information to help get things done. Example: Sending an email with the URL to the information you need to get done.

item.title: Personal Knowledge Management
item.description: A combination of [Resource/wiki/pkm/Personal Information Management|Personal Information Management] and [Resource/wiki/pkm/Knowledge Management|Knowledge Management]. Things to note: Everything should be curated. Not everything needs to be noted down or stored in the PKM system.

item.title: Plan for after summer season ends
item.description: Steamboat Nov 22? Thoughts about what to do and where to go: 10,002 miles needed to keep silver medallion $1240 to spend

item.title: Quartz
item.description: I’m not entirely sure what Quartz does. It might be a static site generator with digital gardens as a focus? Meant to be used with [[Resource/wiki/productivity/Obsidian]].

item.title: Scope
item.description: I just finished a phone interview for my winter job, and the person I spoke to asked a question about what motivates me to come in to work with a positive attitude.

item.title: Structuring the Garden
item.description: First Thoughts Some of my first thoughts on how I want this to look: I really like the Map of Content from https://www.

item.title: Taxonomies
item.description: Taxonomies are categories. From my understand they are what we would consider tags. In the example, given by [[Resource/wiki/web design/Hugo|Hugo]], of a movie site some taxonomies(tags) would be: Actors Directors Studios Genres Year Awards
